newsitem.title: USA: Carr Gottstein discontinues two businesses.
newsitem.headline: Carr Gottstein discontinues two businesses.

text.p: Carr Gottstein Foods Co said on Wednesday that it closed two businesses during the second quarter to focus on its core retail business and took a one-time, pre-tax restructuring charge of $8.9 million.
Carr Gottstein said in a news release that it closed its YES FOODS institutional food service and discontinued its wholesaling services to a Russian export business.
The company reported a second quarter operating profit of $0.02 per share, compared with an operating loss of $0.05 for the year-ago quarter.
Including the charge, the company had a second-quarter net loss of $0.64 per share, compared with a loss of $0.05.
Carr Gottstein said it expects total capital spending for the current year to range between $6.0 million and $8.0 million.
Carr Gottstein operates 45 stores in Alaska, a food warehouse and distribution center, and a freight company.
